Question 1.Question: The Inspector General of Police is appointed by the executive on the advice of the
Question 1.Explanation: The functions of the Nigeria Police Council include; the organization and administration of the Nigeria Police Force and all other matters relating thereto; the general supervision of the Nigeria Police Force; and advising the President on the appointment of the Inspector-General of Police. The Police Service Commissionon the other hand is the civilian oversight body on the police. It is responsible for appointment, promotion, and discipline of all police officers except the office of Inspector General of Police which is handled by the Police Council.

Question 8.Question: The immediate cause of the 1966 military coup de’etat in Nigeria was
Question 8.Explanation: The 1966 Nigerian coup d'état began on January 15, 1966 when mutinous Nigerian soldiers led by Kaduna Nzeogwu assassinated 11 senior Nigerian politicians and two soldiers as well as kidnapped three others. Before military intervention in government in 1966, a lot of occurrences which caused political instability were paramount in government.
